# init(_:)

**Initializer**

Creates a font object corresponding to the font specified by a PostScript or full name.

## Declaration

```swift
init?(_ name: CFString)
```

## Parameters

- **name**: The PostScript or full name of a font.

## Return Value

The font object or `NULL` if the font can’t be created. In Objective-C, you’re responsible for releasing this object using [doc://com.apple.coregraphics/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGFontRelease].

## Discussion

Before drawing text in a Core Graphics context, you must set the font in the current graphics state by calling the function [doc://com.apple.coregraphics/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGContext/setFont(_:)].

## Creating Font Objects

- **init(_:)**: Creates a font object from data supplied from a data provider.
